summary: This is a medical/death report for Jeffrey Epstein following his death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM). It documents his medical history, the cause of death as suicide by hanging (asphyxiation) in his cell on August 10, 2019, and details his placement on and removal from suicide watch prior to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 66-year-old male inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, with ligature marks around his neck; the report details his medical history and the circumstances of his death.

events.title: Epstein Intake at NYM
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken into custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM).

events.title: Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch following an incident involving a string/rope around his neck.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with ligature marks around his neck; cause of death ruled as suicide by hanging (asphyxiation).

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's cause of death is officially listed as suicide by hanging (asphyxiation) on August 10, 2019.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch on July 23, 2019, after a prior incident involving a string/rope around his neck.
The report notes that prior to his death, Epstein had denied suicidal ideation and intention during PDS (Psychological Data System) encounters, including one on August 8, 2019.
Epstein had a cell mate at the time of his death, and staff reported no unusual behaviors or signs of distress.
The document is marked 'SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED (SBU)' and is part of a set of records (referencing EFTA00040940).
